vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐνεργ-έω,
to be in action or activity, operate, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; especially of divine or supernatural action, frequently in NT., τινί, ἔν τινι, [NT]:—middle, [NT]
__2 to be efficacious, of drugs, [Refs 1st c.AD+]; to be effective, of troops, ταῖς σαρίσαις [Refs 2nd c.AD+]:—passive, to be the object of action, [Refs 4th c.BC+]; also, to be actualized, [Refs 3rd c.AD+]
__II transitive, effect, execute, πάντα κατὰ δύναμιν [Refs 2nd c.BC+]:—passive, to be actively carried on, ὁ πόλεμος ἐνηργεῖτο [Refs 2nd c.BC+]things executed, [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
__III in Medicine texts, of sexual intercourse, τὴν τοιαύτην πρᾶξιν -οῦσι μετρίως [Refs] in opere esse, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]
__IV operate, in surgery, [Refs 4th c.AD+]; ὁ ἐνεργῶν, ὁ ἐνεργούμενος, the surgeon, the patient, [Refs 2nd c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to be at work in; to produce active
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to be at work in; to produce active
to effect, 1Cor. 12:6, 11; Gal. 3:5; Eph. 1:11; Phil. 2:13; to put into operation, Eph. 1:20; absolute to be active, Mt. 14:2; Mk. 6:14; Eph. 2:2; in NT to communicate energy and efficiency, Gal. 2:8; passive or middle to come into activity, be actively developed; to be active, be in operation, towards a result, 2Cor. 4:12; 2Thess. 2:7; to be an active power or principle, Rom. 7:5; 1Thess. 2:12; instinct with activity; in action, operative, 2Cor. 1:6; Gal. 5:6; Eph. 3:20; Col. 1:29; earnest, Jas. 5:16
vocabInfos._es_Definition: intrans. obrar, estar obrando, ser operativo ; ser efectivo ; trans. efectuar, realizar, llevar a cabo ; tiene efectos poderosos (SAN.5:16) ; por lo general de actividad sobrenatural
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 發揮作用, 活躍, 有效力
2) 工作, 製造, 影響
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 发挥作用, 活跃, 有效力
2) 工作, 制造, 影响
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: vận hành; tác động; hành động. Xem G1756
